page.title: 07LONG ASHTON NATURE TRAIL
page.content: Dawson's Walk is a nature trail built by villagers, who lost the campaign to stop the building of a new housing estate. They decided to use the remaining land for a nature trail, this land being donated by Mr Dawson. The Walk passes by a small pond, through woods, by a flowing stream and waterfall. Around the Walk are a few benches and some flights of steps made from earth supported by wood. It is a 25-30 minute walk around.It was opened on 14th November, 1982, and a competition was held to find the best name and advertising poster for the Walk. Both winning entries were from Birdwell School. No financial help was given by Avon or Woodspring Councils and the project was entirely a village effort, costing the Parish Council only Â£400.
